Docs.summary: Encodes and Decodes strings as Base64Url encoding.

Docs.summary: Decodes the string from Base64UrlEncoded to UTF8.

Docs.summary: Converts the specified string, which encodes binary data as base-64-url digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Encode (byte[] inArray);
.method public static hidebysig string Encode(unsigned int8[] inArray) cil managed
Public Shared Function Encode (inArray As Byte()) As String
static member Encode : byte[] -> string

Docs.summary: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64-url digits. Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, and the number of elements in the array to convert.
Docs.returns: The string representation in base 64 url encodingof length elements of inArray, starting at position offset.
Docs.exception: offset or length is negative OR offset plus length is greater than the length of inArray.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Encode (string arg);
.method public static hidebysig string Encode(string arg) cil managed
Public Shared Function Encode (arg As String) As String
static member Encode : string -> string

Docs.summary: The following functions perform base64url encoding which differs from regular base64 encoding as follows * padding is skipped so the pad character '=' doesn't have to be percent encoded * the 62nd and 63rd regular base64 encoding characters ('+' and '/') are replace with ('-' and '_') The changes make the encoding alphabet file and URL safe.
Docs.returns: Base64Url encoding of the UTF8 bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Encode (byte[] inArray, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: The number of elements of inArray to convert.
